original: The building currently housing the Museo del Prado in Madrid was constructed prior to the French Revolution to facilitate the public display of portions of the royal art collection. Similar royal galleries accessible to the public were established in cities such as Vienna and Munich. The opening of the Musée du Louvre in 1793, during the French Revolution, marked a significant milestone in the evolution of public access to art, as it transitioned ownership of the former French royal collection to a republican state.
